page.title: 10ST. MARY'S CHURCH, SEND
page.content: The Parish Church of St. Mary the Virgin is on the site of an earlier church mentioned in the Domesday Book. The chancel (built 1200) is the oldest part of the present church. The nave and tower date from about 1475. The porch is early Tudor. A lychgate was added in 1895.The church (originally administered by the monks of Newark Priory) stands near the banks of the River Wey. The monks travelled by boat from the Priory to Church.{Interesting {features:}two Early Engish lancet and side windows. Priest's door. Mass Dial on wall to right of porch. Heavily studded door, with original 15th century lock case. Gallery built in 1670, entered originally by external wooden steps.Belfry housing six bells, first mentioned in 1552, recast and hung in new steel cage(1948). Medieval chest(1325). Unusual memorial tablets.
